name: Harriet Tubman National Historical Park
description: Harriet Tubman was guided by a deep faith and devotion to family, freedom, and community. After emancipating herself and members of her family, she moved them from Ontario, Canada to Fleming and Auburn, New York in 1859. Central New York was a center for progressive thought, abolition, and women’s suffrage where Tubman continued to fight for human rights and dignity until she died in 1913.
shortDescription: Harriet Tubman was guided by a deep faith and devotion to family, freedom, and community. After emancipating herself and members of her family, she moved them from Ontario, Canada to Fleming and Aubur...

operatingHours.description:
Harriet Tubman helped raise funds to build the Thompson Memorial African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church at 49 Parker Street. The church is open for self-guided tours during open hours, while the parsonage serves as a visitor contact station. 

Please note: hours may be subject to change seasonally.

climate.weatherDescription: Auburn, New York has four distinct seasons. Fall and spring are usually mild and summers tend to be sunny, warm, and humid. Winter weather is variable and conditions can change quickly. Snow in November is not uncommon. The heaviest snowfall tends to be in January with an average of 33”.

images.title: Thompsom A.M.E. Zion Church
images.altText: A tall, green and orange painted church steeple, against a blue sky, with a tree in the foreground.
images.caption: The Thompson A.M.E. Zion Church and parsonage are the primary buildings for visitors to Harriet Tubman NHP. They are currently undergoing restoration.

images.title: Harriet Tubman Residence
images.altText: Brick building surrounded by autumn trees
images.caption: Tubman's Auburn residence.

images.title: Thompson Memorial A.M.E. Zion Church
images.altText: Wooden church with tall steeple, with construction equipment out front.
images.caption: Located near Tubman's home, the church continues to honor Tubman's legacy of freedom.

images.title: Tubman Grave
images.caption: Tubman grave at Fort Hill Cemetery
